intro: Hoffmannia macrosiphon var. macrosiphon, commonly known as the large-siphon hoffmannia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
